channel.title: A question about deobs
channel.description: When they(Jagex) do a major change to the game system, we have to do a deob, right? When they have some minor changes to the game, do we have to do a new deob or something?I was wondering about the broken Rs2 revolution autoupdating client, does the "updating" have anything to do with these minor changes?

item.title: A question about deobs
item.dc:creator: @defyboy defyboy
item.description:
@defyboy wrote:

You can change the client version to login, But they also change the frames.

Read full topic

item.title: A question about deobs
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, see it as this way…

When they release a new client it is almost completely different from the last. It’s the same structure, but in no way is it the same code. (I don’t think I’m getting my point across with saying that, but that’s as far as I can go with that one) Plus, they check client versions when you go to login. You can open the client, but it’ll return an error upon login.

Read full topic

item.title: A question about deobs
item.dc:creator: @the_one1 the one
item.description:
@the_one1 wrote:

Just asking, I am confused, thats why…

Read full topic

item.title: A question about deobs
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Don’t use Deobs anymore. They are a quick asking for a ban.

Whenever Runescape updates the client, you too must update. That’s just how it is.

Read full topic
